item.description:
Even though this is about a geocache site it provides some good information about Kuncanowet Town Forest:

http://www.geocaching.com/seek/cache_details.aspx?guid=f3a88fcd-266d-4785-b29c-87f699d2058e

Here is a link to a trail map:

http://img.geocaching.com/cache/log/c0a571f1-9abf-45a8-a432-94639788ac97.jpg

Using the Mill Pond Trail, Pond View Trail, Lost Lake Loop Trail, Gum Tree Trail, Gorham Pond Trail, and Hobble Brush Trail we will do an approximately 6 mile loop hike taking in the views of 3 different ponds, hills and dales, and interesting rock formations.  The pleasant scenery begins while driving to the trailhead.

I was finally able to find a trip report someone did on everytrail.com:

http://www.everytrail.com/fullscreen.php?trip_id=1510264

You will definitely want to enlarge the image and maybe view it in terrain mode as well.

The neat thing about the above trip report is by putting it in statistics mode you can see where you are on the trail and the elevation, miles walked so far, speed of walking, etc.  Check out some photos in the photo album.

This report says the elevation along the trail ranges in between 436 feet - 676 feet elevation which is a 240 difference in elevation, which isn't that much.  However as it is hilly the constant uphill and downhill as shown on the graph means the elevation gain adds up.  So the total elevation gain could be in the neighborhood of 3107 feet but never more than 240 feet uphill at any one time before you start a downhill stretch again.

40 photos have been uploaded as a preview of the hike.

http://www.meetup.com/Manchester-Doggie-Paws/photos/9743822/

group.name: Human Soles & Doggie Paws Hikers & Walkers of Manchester, NH

item.name: Kuncanowet Town Forest & Conservation Area - Gorham Pond - 6.5 Mi. Moderate Hike
